title: Bellator 232 weigh-in results: MacDonald-Lima set, but van Roosmalen nearly 10 pounds heavy
text:
UNCASVILLE, Conn. – MMA Junkie was on scene and reporting live from Friday’s early and official Bellator 232 fighter weigh-ins, where the headliners hit their marks – but one fight was canceled.

Welterweight champion Rory MacDonald (21-5-1 MMA, 3-1-1 BMMA) meets former champ Douglas Lima (31-7 MMA, 13-3 BMMA) in a rematch for MacDonald’s title. The fight doubles as the final of the welterweight grand prix tournament, and the winner will get a $1 million bonus.

Lima weighed in first and was 169.25 pounds. MacDonald came later in the weigh-ins window and was 169.25, as well, to make their fight official.

But one main card fight had to be canceled. Robin van Roosmalen (2-0 MMA, 0-0 BMMA) came in nearly 10 pounds overweight for his featherweight fight against Cris Lencioni (5-2 MMA, 2-2 BMMA). Van Roosmalen was 155.25 pounds, even with use of a towel. Lencioni weighed in early in the window and was 145.25.

After van Roosmalen missed weight, commission head Mike Mazzulli told him because his weight still was within 10 pounds of his opponent, he would OK the fight to happen – but only if Lencioni and Bellator approved it. He also told van Roosmalen that he would file a note with the Association of Boxing Commissions to require him to fight at lightweight moving forward.

When Lencioni met with Bellator officials, he initially declined to take the fight with van Roosmalen at the higher weight. So that bout, scheduled to open the main card, has been canceled. A Bellator official told MMA Junkie the prelim fight between Kevin Ferguson Jr. and Craig Campbell will move to the main card.

And main card fighter Isaiah Chapman (9-3 MMA, 0-0 BMMA) was a quarter-pound over for his bantamweight fight against Patrick Mix (11-0 MMA, 1-0 BMMA). Chapman was fined 20 percent of his purse, which goes to Mix.

The early weigh-ins took place at Mohegan Sun Arena in Uncasville, Conn., and precede the ceremonial weigh-ins for the fans, which take place at 12:30 p.m. ET at the same venue.

Bellator 232 takes place Saturday at Mohegan Sun Arena. The main card streams on DAZN following prelims on MMA Junkie.

The full Bellator 232 weigh-in results included:

MAIN CARD (DAZN, 10 p.m. ET)

Champ Rory MacDonald (169.25) vs. Douglas Lima (169.25) – for welterweight title, welterweight tournament final

Saad Awad (173) vs. Paul Daley (174.75) – 175-pound catchweight

Isaiah Chapman (136.25)* vs. Patrick Mix (136)

Manny Muro (160) vs. Nick Newell (159.75) – 160-pound catchweight

Cris Lencioni (145.25) vs. Robin van Roosmalen (155.25)**

PRELIMINARY CARD (MMA Junkie, 6:45 p.m. ET)

Ryan Hardy Evans (170) vs. Demetrios Plaza (170)

Craig Campbell (158) vs. Kevin Ferguson Jr. (160) – 160-pound catchweight

Lance Gibson Jr. (155) vs. Dominic Jones (154.25)

Devin Powell (155.25) vs. Marcus Surin (155)

Dan Cormier (125.5) vs. John Lopez (124)

John Douma (135) vs. Jornel Lugo (136)

Zarrukh Adashev (125.5) vs. Tevin Dyce (125.25)

*Chapman was a quarter-pound over the bantamweight limit and fined 20 percent of his purse, which goes to Mix.

**Van Roosmalen missed the featherweight limit by more than 9 pounds. Commission head Mike Mazzulli told MMA Junkie Van Roosmalen will be required to fight at lightweight moving forward. Lencioni declined to take the fight at a catchweight, so that bout is canceled. The prelim fight between Craig Campbell and Kevin Ferguson Jr. was moved to the main card.
